intro: Dichoropetalum longibracteolatum, commonly known as the long-bract dichoropetalum, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, featuring two different types of petals, which is reflected in its genus name "Dichoropetalum." The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, while the inflorescence consists of clusters of small, showy flowers. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
